snippet: I don’t want my guests to squirm the way they do in old episodes of “The Addams Family,” when Lurch answers the door with Uncle Fester close behind.
abstract: Jennifer Conlin Reverse Parenting column on living with her extended family; says together they can live much better, financially and emotionally, than they could apart; notes by sharing the work of each age group, they are all less burdened.
lead_paragraph: I don’t want my guests to squirm the way they do in old episodes of “The Addams Family,” when Lurch answers the door with Uncle Fester close behind.

headline.seo: Living With Parents Is the Norm Overseas
headline.main: Guests: Meet My Relatives (They Live Here, Too)
headline.print_headline: Guests: Meet My Relatives (They Live Here, Too)
